### Setup knitr and load utility functions
```{r setup}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
knitr::opts_knit$set(root.dir="E:/DISC/reproducibility")
```
```{r}
utilities_path = "./source/utilities.r"
source(utilities_path)
```
### Load Data
The cluster assignments for 156,049 mice nuclei were extracted as <a href="https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/iyhaoo/DISC/blob/master/reproducibility/data_preparation_and_imputation/data_preprocessing_BRAIN_SPLiT.ipynb">this script</a>.
```{r}
cell_type = as.matrix(read.table("./data/BRAIN_SPLiT/original_data/cluster_assignment.tsv", sep = "\t", row.names = 1))[, 1]
saveRDS(cell_type, "./data/BRAIN_SPLiT/cell_type.rds")
```
### Reference
Rosenberg, A. B. et al. Single-cell profiling of the developing mouse brain and spinal cord with split-pool barcoding. Science 360, 176-182 (2018).
